adverbs.description: genetically (comparative more genetically, superlative most genetically)

entries.meaning: In terms of origin or development.
examples: Hildebrandt is certainly right in maintaining that all dream-images could be explained genetically, if we spent sufficient time and concentration on tracing their origin.

entries.meaning: In a manner relating to genes or genetics.
examples: John Smith is genetically related to Jane Doe.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) By being members of the same linguistic family.
examples: German and Danish are genetically related.
